Package helper

Class CollectionLists

java.lang.Object
helper.CollectionLists
public abstract class CollectionLists extends Object
This is the class for CollectionLists. It contains variables and methods that populates combo boxes and helps with time-related operations.

  • Method Details

    • checkTimeRange

      public static boolean checkTimeRange(LocalDateTime startLDT, LocalDateTime endLDT)
      The method compares LocalDateTimes passed into it against 8:00AM - 10:00PM ET.
      Parameters:
      startLDT - Obtained from either Add or Update Appointment view, this is the start time of a potential or updated appointment.
      endLDT - Obtained from either Add or Update Appointment view, this is the end time of a potential or updated appointment.
      Returns:
      Returns a boolean that checks the Eastern Time availability.

    • loadTimes

      public static void loadTimes()
      The method that adds LocalTime objects into an ObservableList. Times from 00:00 to 23:30 are created in 30 minute intervals.

    • getTimes

      public static javafx.collections.ObservableList<LocalTime> getTimes()
      This is used to populate the Start and End combo boxes in Add and Update Appointment. Contains boolean flag so that the static list is only loaded once.
      Returns:
      Returns the ObservableList of LocalTime objects created from the loadTimes method.

    • loadPlaces

      public static void loadPlaces()
      The method that adds the officeLocation String array into an ObservableList. The locations are a predetermined list from the Task Assessment.

    • getPlaces

      public static javafx.collections.ObservableList<String> getPlaces()
      This method is used to populate the location combo boxes in the main appointment dashboard, as well as Add and Update Appointment views.
      Returns:
      Returns an ObservableList that is filled with the 4 locations.

    • returnUpdateLocation

      public static int returnUpdateLocation(String location)
      This is used to set the location combo box in the Update Customer view when a customer is selected to update.
      Returns:
      Returns the index location of the given location in the location ObservableList.

    • loadTypes

      public static void loadTypes()
      The method that adds the typeAppointment String array into an ObservableList. The types are a predetermined list that are fictional, but utilizes two that are listed in the provided database.

    • getTypes

      public static javafx.collections.ObservableList<String> getTypes()
      This method is used to populate the location combo boxes in the main appointment dashboard, as well as Add and Update Appointment views.
      Returns:
      Returns an ObservableList that is filled with the 4 locations.

    • loadMonths

      public static void loadMonths()
      The method that adds the months String array into an ObservableList. All 12 months are listed in this ObservableList and are used to populate the month combo box to use with the month and type report on the main dashboard.

    • getMonths

      public static javafx.collections.ObservableList<String> getMonths()
      This method is used to populate the month combo boxes in the main appointment dashboard. A boolean flag is used to load the ObservableList once.
      Returns:
      Returns an ObservableList, filled with months of the year.

    • myFormattedDTF

      public static String myFormattedDTF(LocalDateTime myLDT)
      This method is used to display a formatted date and time for showing the next appointment upon login, and for the data recorded in login_activity.txt.
      Parameters:
      myLDT - A LocalDateTie object representing the current time.
      Returns:
      Returns a String that uses a DateTimeFormatter to format a LocalDateTime object.

    • myFormattedTF

      public static String myFormattedTF(LocalTime myLT)
      This method is used to display a formatted time for showing overlapping time details in Add and Update Appointment views.
      Parameters:
      myLT - LocalTime object that comes from the database, converted from a timestamp.
      Returns:
      Returns a String that uses a DateTimeFormatter to format a LocalTime object.
